question: Which segment is used to store interrupt and subroutine return address registers?

What is the output of the following program?

#define BIT3(0x1<<3)
static int a=17;
void main()
{
printf('%x %x', a |= BIT3, a &= ~BIT3);
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main()
{
char *s[] = {'WISS','Software','Tech','Solutions'};
char **p;
p=s;
printf('%s',++*p);
printf('%s',*p++);
printf('%s ',++*p);
}

How many times is 'software developer' printed in the following program?

void main()
{
int x;
for(x=-1; x<=10; x++)
{
if(x < 5)
continue;
else
break;
print('software developer');
}
return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following program?

int main()
{
float f = 1.0;
int i1 = (int) f;
int i2 = *(int *)&f;
printf('%d\n', i1);
printf('%s\n', i2);
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main()
{
float a = 1.1;
double b = 1.1;
if(a == b)
printf('software developer');
else
printf('ML developer');
}

What is the output of the following program when 'Winger IT' is passed as an argument?

#include
#include
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
int flag = 0;
char passwd[10];
memset(passwd, 0, sizeof(passwd));
strcpy(passwd, argv[1]);
if (0 == strcmp('Smart', passwd))
{
flag = 1;
}
if (flag)
{
printf(' i am smart ');
}
else
{
printf(' i am intelleget ');
}
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main(void)
{
char *ptr = "HTTP";
printf(" [%c] ", *ptr++);
printf(" [%c] ", *ptr);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
int main(void)
{
int a = 10, b = 20, c = 30;
printf("\n %d,%d,%d\n", a + b + c, (b = b * 2), (c = c * 2));
return 0;
}
What macro definition correctly calculates the number of seconds in a non-leap year?
Using the variable x, which of the following defines an array of ten pointers to functions that take an integer argument and return an integer?

What is the output of the following program?

#include
union address {
char *name;
char street[10];
int pin;
};
int main() {
union address emp, *p;
emp.name = "Hu/Obli";
p = &emp;
printf("%s%s", p->name, (*p).name);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
struct emp {
char *name;
int id;
};
int main() {
static struct emp e1 = {"A", 1}, e2 = {"B", 2}, e3 = {"C", 3};
struct emp (*array[]) = {&e1, &e2, &e3};
struct emp (*(*ptr)[3]) = &array;
printf("%s %d", (**(*ptr + 1)).name, (*(ptr + 1))->id);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
int main(void) {
int a = 7;
int b = 1;
if (a >= b) {
int temp = a;
a = b;
b = temp;
}
printf("a=%d\tb=%d\n", a, b);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
#include
void main() {
int i = 0;
for (; i < 2;) {
printf("%d", ++i);
}
}

#include
int main() {
printf(1+"%d", 4);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following code?

int main() {
printf("%d", printf("Winger IT Solutions"));
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
#include
int main() {
int *p = malloc(sizeof(int));
*p = 10;
free(p);
printf("%d", *p);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
int main() {
int x = 5;
int y = 10;
int z = (x > y) ? x : y;
printf("%d", z);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include
int main() {
int a = 0;
int b = 1;
int c = 2;
a = (b > c) ? b : c;
printf("%d %d %d", a, b, c);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

#include

char str1[20] = "Hello";
char str2[20] = "World";
strcat(str1, str2);
printf("%s", str1);
return 0;
}
A sum of money at simple interest amounts to Rs. 815 in 3 years and to Rs. 854 in 4 years. The sum is:

Mr. Thomas invested an amount of Rs. 13,900 divided into two different schemes A and B at the simple interest rates of 14% p.a. and 11% p.a., respectively. If the total amount of simple interest earned in 2 years is Rs. 3508, what was the amount invested in Scheme B?
A sum fetched a total simple interest of Rs. 4016.25 at the rate of 9% p.a. in 5 years. What is the sum?
How much time will it take for an amount of Rs. 450 to yield Rs. 81 as interest at 4.5% per annum of simple interest?
Reena took a loan of Rs. 1200 with simple interest for as many years as the rate of interest. If she paid Rs. 432 as interest at the end of the loan period, what was the rate of interest?
A can do a work in 15 days and B in 20 days. If they work on it together for 4 days, then the fraction of the work that is left is:
A can lay a railway track between two given stations in 16 days and B can do the same job in 12 days. With the help of C, they did the job in 4 days only. Then, C alone can do the job in:
A, B, and C can do a piece of work in 20, 30, and 60 days respectively. In how many days can A do the work if he is assisted by B and C on every third day?
A is thrice as good a workman as B and therefore is able to finish a job in 60 days less than B. Working together, they can do it in:
A alone can do a piece of work in 6 days and B alone in 8 days. A and B undertook to do it for Rs. 3200. With the help of C, they completed the work in 3 days. How much is to be paid to C?
A and B invest in a business in the ratio 3:2. If 5% of the total profit goes to charity and A's share is Rs. 855, the total profit is:
